intro: Catocoma myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf catocoma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Catocoma myrtifolia typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
